conclusion: Understand the circuit and relationships between components.
Circuit consists of resistance R1, electric motor M, and ammeter A.
Switch is open, ammeter reads I0 = 0.5 A.
Resistance R1 is connected in series with electric motor M.
Switch is closed, electric motor starts to rotate, voltage remains unchanged.
Power P consumed by circuit can be calculated using P = V x I.
Ammeter reads I0 = 0.5 A, resistance R1 is 20 Ω, internal resistance R2 is 10 Ω.
Switch is closed, electric motor starts to rotate, voltage remains unchanged.
Power P consumed by circuit is the power of the electric motor.
Power P of electric motor can be calculated using P = V x I.
Since voltage V remains unchanged, use formula P = V x I.
Power P consumed by circuit is equal to 15 W.
